VIII.iii.3.B.1.a
.
Presumptive SC Based on Exposure to Mustard Gas or Lewisite
Under
38 CFR 3.316
, presumptive service connection (SC) can be established when there is
in-service full-body exposure to a vesicant agent (mustard gas or Lewisite), and
a diagnosis of a condition associated with the type of verified exposure as listed in
38 CFR 3.316(a)
.
The presumption removes the need to prove a nexus between the current diagnosis and the in-service exposure.  Therefore, when the evidence is sufficient for the presumption to arise, SC is established (assuming that generally applicable requirements such as Veteran status based on a qualifying discharge have been met)
unless
other evidence rebuts the presumption.
Reference
:  For more information on the definitions of full-body exposure, mustard gas, and Lewisite, see
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iii, 3.A.1.a
.
